page.title: 17 FARMING AND THE LANDSCAPE
page.content: In this area the farming has not changed the landscape too much. The co-op have pulled out a lot of hedges on their farms to make room for their combined harvesters by making the fields bigger.Quite a lot of farmers pipe ditches off to make fields bigger and to save money because they do not have to build bridges .This has often meant moving hedges which are along side the ditch.The colour of landscape has changed as well as there are now oilseed rape crops so there are fields which are bright yellow in May and June.Many farms still have cows or bullocks grazing and so they leave the trees and hedges in.The hedges usally look neat now because of the mechanical hedge cutters on the tractors.
